title: Gelug
summary: The Gelug (Wylie: dGe-Lugs; sometimes spelled Géluk, meaning "virtuous"[1]) is the newest of the four major schools of Tibetan Buddhism.[2] It was founded by Je Tsongkhapa (1357–1419), a Tibetan philosopher, tantric yogi and lama and further expanded and developed by his disciples (such as Khedrup Je, Gyaltsap Je and Gendün Drubpa).[1]
